info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 5:09PM EDT until July 12 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... Southeastern Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 509 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Middlefield to Millerton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Torrington, New Hartford, Becket, Norfolk, Otis, Canaan, Sandisfield, Falls Village, Winsted, New Hartford Center, Ashley Falls, Northwest Harwinton, Barkhamsted, Salisbury, New Marlborough, Colebrook, Monterey, South Norfolk, West Torrington and Sodom. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
